question_stem: The function \(g(x)\) is defined for all real \(x\) and has a minimum point at \((-2, 5)\).

parts.question_text: The function \(h(x)\) is defined as \(h(x) = g(x) - 2\). State the coordinates of the minimum point of \(h(x)\).
parts.solution_text: The graph of \(h(x)\) is a vertical translation of the graph of \(g(x)\) by 2 units downwards.  Therefore, the minimum point of \(h(x)\) is at \((-2, 5-2) = (-2, 3)\).
